metadata.title: CVE-2020-26965 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - low.
metadata.description: Some websites have a feature "Show Password" where clicking a button will change a password field into a textbook field, revealing the typed password. If, when using a software keyboard that remembers user input, a user typed their password and used that feature, the type of the password field was changed, resulting in a keyboard layout change and the possibility for the software keyboard to remember the typed password. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 83, Firefox ESR < 78.5, and Thunderbird < 78.5.

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '83.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.5.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
